sen.j: 平等寺（びょうどうじ）は、奈良県桜井市三輪にある現在は曹洞宗の寺院。
sen.e: Located at Miwa Sakurai City Nara Prefecture, Byodo-ji Temple now belongs to the Soto sect.
Located at Miwa Sakurai City Nara Prefecture, Byodo-ji Temple now belongs to the Soto sect.
Located at Miwa Sakurai City Nara Prefecture, Byodo-ji Temple now belongs to the Soto sect.

sen.j: 三輪別所ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called Miwa-bessho (remote religious facilities from main temple facilities).
It is also called Miwa-bessho (remote religious facilities from main temple facilities).
It is also called Miwa-bessho (remote religious facilities from main temple facilities).

sen.j: 本尊は釈迦如来である。
sen.e: The principal image is Shaka Nyorai.
The principal image is Shaka Nyorai.
The principal image is Shaka Nyorai.

sen.j: かつては、大神神社の神宮寺であった。
sen.e: It was once Jingu-ji Temple (temples associated with shrines) of Omiwa-jinja Shrine.
It was once Jingu-ji Temple (temples associated with shrines) of Omiwa-jinja Shrine.
It was once Jingu-ji Temple (temples associated with shrines) of Omiwa-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 創建は未詳。
sen.e: It is not known when it was founded.
It is not known when it was founded.
It is not known when it was founded.

sen.j: 寺伝は聖徳太子を開基としている。
sen.e: Its temple history says that it was founded by Prince Shotoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its temple history says that it was founded by Prince Shotoku.
Its temple history says that it was founded by Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: しかし『大神神社史』は、「平等寺境内の開山堂に慶円の像を安置していた」ことを根拠に、寺伝を否定し、慶円を開山者としている。
sen.e: However "Omiwa-Jinja Shi" (The history of Omiwa-Jinja Shrine) denies it, saying that it was founded by Kyoen on the ground that "a statue of Kyoen was enshrined in Kaisan-do Hall (temple where the statue of founder priest is placed) of the temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However "Omiwa-Jinja Shi" (The history of Omiwa-Jinja Shrine) denies it, saying that it was founded by Kyoen on the ground that 'a statue of Kyoen was enshrined in Kaisan-do Hall (temple where the statue of founder priest is placed) of the temple.'

However "Omiwa-Jinja Shi" (The history of Omiwa-Jinja Shrine) denies it, saying that it was founded by Kyoen on the ground that 'a statue of Kyoen was enshrined in Kaisan-do Hall (temple where the statue of founder priest is placed) of the temple.'

sen.j: 『大三輪町史』は、空海説の存在も述べている。
sen.e: "The history of Omiwa-cho Town" suggests that it was founded by Kukai.
"The History of Omiwa-cho Town" suggests that it was founded by Kukai.
sen.cmt: The History of Omiwa-cho Town 書籍名なので各語頭を大文字にしました。
sen.e: "The History of Omiwa-cho Town" suggests that it was founded by Kukai.

sen.j: 史料上はっきりとした記述は、古代にはあらわれない。
sen.e: There is no specific descriptions of the temple in historical materials of ancient times.
There is no specific descriptions of the temple in historical materials of ancient times.
There is no specific descriptions of the temple in historical materials of ancient times.

sen.j: 史料上、明確に現れてくるのは鎌倉時代以降、「弥勒如来感応抄草」の1236年（嘉禎2）である。
sen.e: Only after the Kamakura Period, it was specifically described in historical materials: Mirokunyorai Kanno Shoso (The selection of the influence of Mirokunyorai) described it in 1236.

Only after the Kamakura period, it was specifically described in historical materials: "Mirokunyorai Kanno Shoso" (The selection of the influence of Mirokunyorai) described it for the fist time in 1236.
sen.cmt: 原文は「」ですが、書物タイトルなので " "に入れました。for the fist time 「初出」の意味を加えました。
sen.e: Only after the Kamakura period, it was specifically described in historical materials: "Mirokunyorai Kanno Shoso" (The selection of the influence of Mirokunyorai) described it for the fist time in 1236.

sen.j: このころに、平等寺が存在し、「三輪別所」と呼称されていたことは問題がなく確実である。
sen.e: It is clear with no question that Byodo-ji Temple existed and was called "Miwa-bessho" at the time.
It is clear with no question that Byodo-ji Temple existed and was called "Miwa-bessho" at the time.
It is clear with no question that Byodo-ji Temple existed and was called "Miwa-bessho" at the time.

sen.j: 慶円によって、大神神社の傍らに真言灌頂の道場が作成された。
sen.e: Keien had a Kanjo Dojo of the Shingon sect built beside Omiwa-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kyoen built a Kanjo Dojo seminary of the Shingon sect beside Omiwa-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 慶円は、Keien→Kyoenで統一しました。Kanjo Dojo→Kanjo Dojo seminary
sen.e: Kyoen built a Kanjo Dojo seminary of the Shingon sect beside Omiwa-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: その道場が「三輪別所」であった。
sen.e: The Dojo was called "Miwa-bessho."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Dojo was called "Miwa-bessho."
The Dojo was called "Miwa-bessho."

sen.j: その後、比較的早い時期には「平等寺」という名称で呼ばれることとなった。
sen.e: Relatively soon after that the temple became called "Byodo-ji Temple."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Relatively soon after that the seminary came to be called "Byodo-ji Temple."
sen.cmt: Relatively soon after that the seminary came to be called "Byodo-ji Temple."
sen.e: Relatively soon after that the seminary came to be called "Byodo-ji Temple."

sen.j: それが、現在、史料ではっきりと確認できる最古の例である。
sen.e: This is the oldest description whereby we can clearly identify the temple in a historical material now
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This is the oldest description whereby we can clearly identify the temple in a historical material now.
sen.cmt: ピリオド追加しました。
sen.e: This is the oldest description whereby we can clearly identify the temple in a historical material now.

sen.j: 鎌倉末期には、同じ神宮寺であった大御輪寺をもしのぎ、大神神社の別当寺の地位にたっていた。
sen.e: In the end of the Kamakura period, the temple filled a post of bettoji (a temple attached to a shrine) of Omiwa-jinja Shrine--the post superior to the same Jingu-ji Temple, Daigorin-ji Temple.

In the end of the Kamakura period, the temple filled a position of betto-ji (a temple attached to a shrine) of Omiwa-jinja Shrine--the position superior to Daigorin-ji Temple, which was also ranked as a jingu-ji (betto-ji).
sen.cmt: 別当寺と神宮寺は同義語なのでjingu-ji (betto-ji)としました
sen.e: In the end of the Kamakura period, the temple filled a position of betto-ji (a temple attached to a shrine) of Omiwa-jinja Shrine--the position superior to Daigorin-ji Temple, which was also ranked as a jingu-ji (betto-ji).

sen.j: 一方で、「大乗院寺社雑事記」には、興福寺が平等寺に御用銭を課していることが見られる。
sen.e: In the meanwhile, Daijoin jisha zojiki (Miscellaneous Records of the Daijo Temple and Shrine) describes that Byodo-ji Temple and other temples were requested by the Kofuku-ji Temple (Sakurai City) to pay money as Goyosen the money paid to the authorities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the meanwhile, "Daijoin jisha zojiki" (Miscellaneous Records of the Daijo Temple and Shrine) describes that Byodo-ji Temple and other temples were imposed Goyosen (the money paid to the authorities) by the Kofuku-ji Temple (Sakurai City).
sen.cmt: 原文は「」ですが、書物タイトルなので " "に入れました。
sen.e: In the meanwhile, "Daijoin jisha zojiki" (Miscellaneous Records of the Daijo Temple and Shrine) describes that Byodo-ji Temple and other temples were imposed Goyosen (the money paid to the authorities) by the Kofuku-ji Temple (Sakurai City).

sen.j: 大和国の他の寺院同様、興福寺の末寺でもあった。
sen.e: Byodo-ji Temple, like other temples in Yamato-no-kuni, was a branch temple of Kofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Byodo-ji Temple, like other temples in Yamato Province, was a branch of Kofuku-ji Temple.
Byodo-ji Temple, like other temples in Yamato Province, was a branch of Kofuku-ji Temple.

sen.j: また、同時に修験道を伝えていたことから、醍醐寺との関係も保持していた。
sen.e: It also retained a relation with Daigo-ji Temple, because it taught Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts).
It also retained a relation with Daigo-ji Temple, because it taught Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts).
It also retained a relation with Daigo-ji Temple, because it taught Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts).

sen.j: そのため、内部に「学衆（興福寺大乗院）」と「禅衆（醍醐寺三宝院）」という、二つの僧侶集団が作られた。
sen.e: This is why two groups of monks were formed in the temple--a group of academic monks (Kofuku-ji Temple Daijo-in) and a group of Zen monks (Sanbo-in of Daigo-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This is why two groups of monks were formed in the temple--a group of academic monks (Kofuku-ji Temple Daijo-in) and a group of Zen monks (Sanbo-in of Daigo-ji Temple).
This is why two groups of monks were formed in the temple--a group of academic monks (Kofuku-ji Temple Daijo-in) and a group of Zen monks (Sanbo-in of Daigo-ji Temple).

sen.j: 両者は共存する関係にあった。
sen.e: The two groups existed together.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The two groups existed together.
The two groups existed together.

sen.j: 室町時代中期には、禅衆と学衆が激しく争ったことも、「大乗院寺社雑事記」には描かれている。
sen.e: Daijoin jisha zojiki also describes that there were fierce conflicts between the groups in the middle of the Muromachi period.
"Daijoin jisha zojiki" also describes that there were fierce conflicts between the groups of academic monks and Zen monks in the middle of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 「禅衆と学衆」訳漏れ： the groups of academic monks and Zen monks
sen.e: "Daijoin jisha zojiki" also describes that there were fierce conflicts between the groups of academic monks and Zen monks in the middle of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、興福寺の支配を離れ、真言宗の寺院となりつつも、修験道も伝えていた。
sen.e: The temple which left the control of Kofuku-ji Temple was becoming a temple of the Shingo sect but taught Shugendo.
Although the temple left the control of Kofuku-ji Temple and became a temple of the Shingo sect, it continued teaching Shugendo.
Although the temple left the control of Kofuku-ji Temple and became a temple of the Shingo sect, it continued teaching Shugendo.

sen.j: 朱印地の石高は80石。
sen.e: Its Shuinchi (temple's territory authorized by the Edo shorgunate) was granted 80-koku (of rice) (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter, lumber 1-koku is 0.278 cubic meter).
Its Shuinchi (temple's territory authorized by the Edo shogunate) had a production of 80 koku (of crop yield).
sen.cmt: was granted 80-koku→ had a production of 80 koku (of crop yield).
sen.e: Its Shuinchi (temple's territory authorized by the Edo shogunate) had a production of 80 koku (of crop yield).

sen.j: また、伽藍配置は、江戸時代の写本により知られる。
sen.e: Its Buddhist temple placement was known to people through a manuscript in the Edo period.
The layout of the temple can be confirmed in a manuscript in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「により知られるの部分をcan be confirmed にしました。
sen.e: The layout of the temple can be confirmed in a manuscript in the Edo period.

sen.j: それによると、三輪山の最端に慶円上人開山堂がある。
sen.e: It depicts Kaisan-do Hall (temple where the statue of founder priest is placed) of Kyoen Shonin deepest in Mt. Miwa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It depicts Kaisan-do Hall (temple where the statue of founder priest is placed), where Kyoen Shonin was enshrined, in the deepest part of Mt. Miwa.
It depicts Kaisan-do Hall (temple where the statue of founder priest is placed), where Kyoen Shonin was enshrined, in the deepest part of Mt. Miwa.

sen.j: 行者堂・御影堂・本堂・一切経堂など、複数の堂舎が存在したことがうかがわれる。
sen.e: It also tells that there were several large and small buildings (in a temple or shrine) such as Gyosha-do Temple, Goeido, Hondo (a main hall), and Issaikyo-do.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It also tells that there were several large and small Buddhist buildings such as Gyojado hall for ascetic training, Mieido hall to enshrine the founder's image, Hondo (a main hall), and Issaikyodo hall to store the Buddhist scriptures.
sen.cmt: 行者堂・御影堂・一切経堂の読み方を確認のうえ、意味の説明を加えました。
sen.e: It also tells that there were several large and small Buddhist buildings such as Gyojado hall for ascetic training, Mieido hall to enshrine the founder's image, Hondo (a main hall), and Issaikyodo hall to store the Buddhist scriptures.

sen.j: 1868年（明治元）、神仏分離の太政官布告が出される。
sen.e: In 1868, the Ordinance Distinguishing Shinto and Buddhism was issued by Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
In 1868, the Ordinance to separate Buddhism and Shintoism (Buddhism and Shintoism Separation Order) was issued by Daijokan (Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: Ordinance Distinguishing Shinto and Buddhism の部分を変更しました。
sen.e: In 1868, the Ordinance to separate Buddhism and Shintoism (Buddhism and Shintoism Separation Order) was issued by Daijokan (Grand Council of State).

sen.j: これにより、1870年（明治3）には、平等寺は三輪社の社人が管理するにいたる。
sen.e: This put Byodo-ji Temple under the control of shanin (shrine priests) of Miwa-sha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This put Byodo-ji Temple under the control of shanin (shrine priests) of Miwa-sha in 1870.
This put Byodo-ji Temple under the control of shanin (shrine priests) of Miwa-sha in 1870.

sen.j: 堂舎は取り払われ、平等寺は廃止となる。
sen.e: Large and small buildings were cleared away and Byodo-ji Temple was closed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Buddhist buildings were cleared away and Byodo-ji Temple was closed.
The Buddhist buildings were cleared away and Byodo-ji Temple was closed.

sen.j: 1959年（昭和34）の『大三輪町史』編纂の段階では、「現在は、その伽藍は存在せず、わずかに塔中の石垣のみが遺跡として存在するとともに、主たる仏像は翠松寺も移されているような現況である」（『大三輪町史』496p）とあるように堂舎は存在せず、一切の建物も残っていない状態となっていた。
sen.e: In the stage of edition of "the history of Omiwa-cho Town," no building, large and small, had already existed, as it states, "No Garan exists, with only a stone wall of a hall remaining, and main Buddha statue and Suishoji temple have been moved." (Page 498 of "The history of Omiwa-cho Town").

In 1954, when "The History of Omiwa-cho Town" was in compilation, 'no trace of the Buddhist buildings is found in the site except for a stone wall left in the pagoda, and principal Buddha statues have been moved to Suisho-ji temple,' ("The History of Omiwa-cho Town," p.469).
sen.cmt: In 1954, when "としました。「仏像は翠松寺も」→「仏像も翠松寺へ」と解釈しました。
sen.e: In 1954, when "The History of Omiwa-cho Town" was in compilation, 'no trace of the Buddhist buildings is found in the site except for a stone wall left in the pagoda, and principal Buddha statues have been moved to Suisho-ji temple,' ("The History of Omiwa-cho Town," p.469).

sen.j: 1977年（昭和52）、曹洞宗の寺院、「三輪山平等寺」として再興した。
sen.e: In 1977, the temple revived as "Byodo-ji Temple, Mt. Miwa" belonging to the Soto sect of Zen Buddhism.
In 1977, the temple was reconstructed as a Zen temple, 'Miwa-san Byodo-ji Temple' of the Soto sect.
sen.cmt: revived→reconstructed"Byodo-ji Temple, Mt. Miwa"→"Miwa-san Byodo-ji Temple" 「三輪山」は山号（prefix）なので前に置き '…-san'としました。
sen.e: In 1977, the temple was reconstructed as a Zen temple, 'Miwa-san Byodo-ji Temple' of the Soto sect.

sen.j: 現在は伽藍も復元されている。
sen.e: Its Garan also revived.
The temple's original layout has been also restored.
sen.cmt: The temple's original layout has been also restored.
sen.e: The temple's original layout has been also restored.
